intro: Chaetaria trichodes, commonly known as the hairy chaetaria, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
